definitions.definition: To surreptitiously penetrate , enter or gain access to.
examples: The spy infiltrated the high-tech company and stole many secrets.

definitions.definition: To cause to penetrate in this way.
examples: The agency infiltrated several spies into the company.

definitions.definition: To pass through something by filtration .
To cause (a liquid) to pass through something by filtration .
To invade or penetrate a tissue or organ .
examples: High-grade tumors often infiltrate surrounding structures.
In certain conditions, immune cells may infiltrate into the cerebrospinal fluid .

definitions.definition: To send (soldiers, spies , etc.) through gaps in the enemy line.
To move from a vein , remaining in the body.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To surreptitiously penetrate , enter or gain access to.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause to penetrate in this way.
( ambitransitive , of a liquid ) To pass through something by filtration .
( transitive ) To cause (a liquid) to pass through something by filtration .
( ambitransitive , medicine ) To invade or penetrate a tissue or organ .
( transitive , military ) To send (soldiers, spies , etc.) through gaps in the enemy line.
( intransitive , of an intravenous needle ) To move from a vein , remaining in the body.
